original:
Thousands of steatite seals have been unearthed from archaeological sites associated with the Indus Valley Civilization (IVC), revealing a consistent physical character. These seals typically measure between ¾ inch and 1½ inches square. Most feature a pierced boss on the reverse side, designed to accommodate a cord for handling or for use as personal adornment.

Notable examples of these seals have been discovered at Mohenjo-Daro. One s
